Class javachart.chart.Gc 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class javachart.chart.Gc 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----javachart.chart.Gc
public class Gc
extends Object
This is a general purpose graphics class for drawing functionality and for storing graphical attributes. Most other JavaChart classes contain at least one Gc instance, which is used for storing things like line color and fill color, as well as drawing methods. Internally, JavaChart uses a "lower left" origin, which is more natural to most chart styles than Java's "top left" origin. The Gc class converts all incoming coordinates into JavaChart's "lower left" origin.
See Also:
RotateString, Globals

Gc(Globals)
Sets the fill, marker, and line color to black.

Draws an arc using the current fill color and JavaChart's coordinates.

A drawLine that uses JavaChart's coordinate system.

Gc 
  public Gc(Globals g)
Sets the fill, marker, and line color to black.
Parameters:
g - This chart's Globals class

getImage 
  public Image getImage()
Returns the Image used with this Gc. For Line and Regress charts this Image is used for data markers. For Bar and Column charts, this Image is the tile for the data bars. Currently not implemented for Bar and Colum charts.
Returns:
Marker image
setImage 
  public void setImage(Image i)
Assigns an Image for use with this Gc. For Line and Regress charts this Image is used to create data markers. For Bar and Column charts, this Image is used as a tile for the data bars. Currently not implemented for Bar and Colum charts.
Parameters:
i - Marker image

drawSmartString 
  protected void drawSmartString(Graphics g,
                                 int startx,
                                 int starty,
                                 int alignment,
                                 int angle,
                                 FontMetrics fm,
                                 String str)
Draws a string in the current color and Font at the specified location, position, and angle. This method attempts to handle strings in a "smart" fashion, adjusting alignment points based on whether the string should remain above, below, to the left, or to the right of the specified location. Strings with a rotation angle are aligned with one of the corners of the string's extent box. Strings with an angle of 0 are centered at the location.
Parameters:
g - Graphics affected
startx - X position of string
starty - Y position of string
alignment - keepABOVE, keepBELOW, etc.
angle - Rotation angle in degrees
fm - A FontMetrics class for the unrotated string
str - The String to draw
drawString 
  protected void drawString(Graphics g,
                            int startx,
                            int starty,
                            String str)
A drawString that uses JavaChart's coordinate system. Also handles null-pointer exceptions.
Parameters:
g - The affected Graphics
startx - X coordinate of starting point
starty - Y coordinate of starting point
str - The string to be drawn
nonSciNumberStr 
  protected static String nonSciNumberStr(String s,
                                          int eIndex)
Converts a numeric String that contains scientific notation into a String without scientific notation
Parameters:
s - String to convert
eIndex - location of the "e" in this string
Returns:
expanded number
formattedLabel 
  protected static String formattedLabel(String s,
                                         int format,
                                         int labelPrecision)
Formats a numeric string into one with commas and periods, according to the specified format
Parameters:
s - Starting string
format - DEFAULT_FORMAT, COMMA_FORMAT, or EURO_FORMAT
Returns:
a formatted string
